name: Kepler-210
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-210 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-210 is a star with 0.5499999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.65 times its radius. It is located 764.28 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-210 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-210 b

Kepler-210 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.45 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-210.

The mass of Kepler-210 b is 12.77 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-210 b is 2.94 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-210 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-210 c

Kepler-210 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.97 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-210.

The mass of Kepler-210 c is 21.10 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-210 c is 3.62 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-210 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-210, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
